text:
When AWS invests in improving
our security and compliance

posture to meet the demands
of a thoughtful customer,

the results are accessible
by all of our customers.

When customers ask me how they
can improve the effectiveness

of their risk management
and compliance programs,

I discuss these topics. AWS
supports a shared responsibility
model for security and compliance.

AWS is responsible for security
and compliance of the cloud
infrastructure and service.

Customers are responsible
for the security and compliance

of the architectures
they build on AWS.

AWS supports 98 security
standards and certifications.

AWS provides on demand access
to these AWS audit reports

and certifications
through AWS Artifact.

Review these reports to identify
what you are inheriting

from AWS and the scope of the
certification or audit.

After this review, you will
be able to identify the controls

that you will still need to implement
and maintain for what you build
on AWS.

When you have identified
what you need to build to meet

your security and compliance
requirements, learn about the
GRC-focused tools at AWS.

Capabilities offered through
AWS cloud governance tools

help you achieve consistent,
centralized compliance

and risk management over your
entire IT estate.

You may also benefit from AWS
Audit Manager, which simplifies

evidence collection to meet
reporting requirements.

While these services offer
a great start to your risk management

and compliance programs,
they are not the only ones you
can benefit from.

AWS offers an exceptional
breadth and depth of controls

across AWS services to help
you meet evolving regulatory

requirements and minimize
security risks.

For more information
on this topic, check out the
links in the description.
